flawed_nl_solution:
Meryll has written 35 questions x 2/5 = <<35*2/5=14>>14 multiple-choice questions.
While she has written 15 questions x 1/3 = <<15*1/3=5>>5 problem-solving questions.
The total number of questions that Meryll has to write is 35 questions + 15 questions = <<35+15=52>>52 questions.
Meryll has written a total of 14 questions + 5 questions = <<14+5=19>>19 questions.
Hence, she needs to write 52 questions - 19 questions = <<52-19=33>>33 questions more.
#### 33

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 50, not 52. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
